body_html:
@ezyang that else if was unnecessary, because the previous conditionals already took care of the specific case.
The fabs(y) < 1 in here is already taken care in here and here, and it only remains (fabs(y) > CENTRAL_RANGE) which is the else from the first if
body_text:
@ezyang that else if was unnecessary, because the previous conditionals already took care of the specific case.
The fabs(y) < 1 in here is already taken care in here and here, and it only remains (fabs(y) > CENTRAL_RANGE) which is the else from the first if
body:
@ezyang that `else if` was unnecessary, because the previous conditionals already took care of the specific case.
The `fabs(y) < 1` in [here](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/commit/2b9765ad02b666d623566935b385fc3d058ad33d#diff-6a89b015a65a10ba52ba750c92183b37R113) is already taken care in [here](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/commit/2b9765ad02b666d623566935b385fc3d058ad33d#diff-6a89b015a65a10ba52ba750c92183b37R104) and [here](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/commit/2b9765ad02b666d623566935b385fc3d058ad33d#diff-6a89b015a65a10ba52ba750c92183b37R105), and it only remains `(fabs(y) > CENTRAL_RANGE)` which is the `else` from the [first if](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/commit/2b9765ad02b666d623566935b385fc3d058ad33d#diff-6a89b015a65a10ba52ba750c92183b37R106)
